intro: Pimpinella smithii, commonly known as Smith's cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the carrot family. Pimpinella smithii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
